infotexts.entitydescription.nightgoggles: Standard issue Coalition Night Vision Goggles. Requires Batteries.
infotexts.entitydescription.organscalpel_eyes: A specialized scalpel for the removal of eyes.
infotexts.entitydescription.eyespoon: A specialized medical gadget for careful extraction of donor eyes. Does not work on humans.
infotexts.entitydescription.eyeglasses: These unregistered prescription glasses may improve patient's vision.
infotexts.entitydescription.muscleconnectors: Used in eye transplants, before putting in the eye, along with eye gel.
infotexts.entitydescription.eyedrops: Use on the eyes to make them recover quicker.
infotexts.entitydescription.eyegel: Used in eye transplants, before putting in the eye, along with muscle connectors.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes: Right out of a human's skull. Used for transplants.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_monste: Right out of a monster's skull. Not great for seeing things, but stylish at parties.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_terror: An eye-like object that is unbeknownst to humanity. Proceed with caution.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_husk: Right out of a husk's skull. Cannot be damaged by water, and has a chance to give the patient husk infection.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_bionic: A metal, much more resistant eye, made for transplantation. Improves vision quality.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_night: A pair of eyes, that comes with night vision implants. Can't be turned off on demand.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_infrar: A pair of eyes with infrared implants. Slightly improves combat skill and vision.
infotexts.entitydescription.transplant_eyes_plasti: A pair of "eyes" Not much better than being blind. While the its hard to see clear with them, at least they look fashionable.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.noeye: The patient's eyes are gone, with empty, red holes being there instead.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyedamage: The patient's eyes look flat, and they have trouble seeing.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyeshock: The patient's immune system did not accept the eye, and is attacking it instead. Eye removal is required to stop it.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyedrop: The patient's eye healing rate has increased.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyeone: The patient has lost all vision in one of the eyes.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyesickness: The patient has trouble seeing, likely because of a recent eye transplant.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyecataract: The patient's eyes look cloudy, and their vision is blurred.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyemuscle: Muscle connectors are attached to the eye holes.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyegell: Eye gel is applied to the eye holes.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyenight: The patient has night vision eyes.
infotexts.afflictionname.eyeterror: THE EYES OF KAR EN TUK
infotexts.afflictiondescription.eyeterror: You feel a comforting sense of bloodlust and strength. You are more resilient. You are alive. You must kill.
